content.text: A new feature called 'Create VangAI' has been introduced, focusing on a Crypto Oracle. The update includes risk assessments and testing procedures.
A Twitter-related update has been proposed, though details remain unspecified. The update includes risk assessments and testing procedures.
An update titled 'Tum work' has been introduced, though specific details are not provided. The update includes risk assessments and testing procedures.
The frontend for Nillion has been integrated, improving the user interface and functionality.
The README file has been enhanced with detailed system requirements, project structure, and contribution guidelines to improve accessibility for new contributors.
The changelog file has been updated to correct incorrect words.
A new feature called 'Fuel AI character setup' has been introduced, though specific details are not provided. The update includes risk assessments and testing procedures.
The Turkish documentation for ElizaOS has been rewritten by a native speaker to improve accuracy and clarity.
Minor typos in the documentation have been corrected to improve clarity and correctness.
Incremental documentation updates have been made, including new README files for client packages, an FAQ section, and a revamped character file page.

A major update has been made to externalize vendor code from the core. This change removes third-party vendor plugins from the core and introduces interfaces to register plugins for handling various functionalities. Model providers have been moved into plugins, and some services have been converted into function handlers. Additionally, some plugins are being developed within the repository before being migrated to their own. The update aims to improve scalability and user reach. The package manager has also been switched from `pnpm` to `bun`.
A minor fix was made by deleting an unnecessary `}` in `alexa-client.ts`.
Updates were made to `reservoir.ts` and `wallet.ts`, replacing old links with new ones.

categories.title: Build Fixes and Improvements for ElizaOS

content.text: A new update ensures that the core must be built first before proceeding with other build steps. A `build:core` command has been added to streamline this process.
A fix has been implemented to resolve issues with running `bun run build` in the root directory, improving the overall build process.
Build configurations and package versions have been updated to ensure compatibility for the Sui Typhoon Hackathon in February 2025. This fix addresses build-related issues and improves stability.

categories.title: Crypto Agents and AI Infrastructure in Blockchain

content.text: A discussion on crypto agents and a related whitepaper has been shared, providing insights into their role in blockchain technology.

Near has developed significant AI infrastructure, focusing on integrating blockchain with AI. They are working on Trusted Execution Environments (TEE) in Multi-Party Computation (MPC) to enhance verifiability. Additionally, they are funding research into on-chain Large Language Models (LLMs) and other AI ventures.

categories.title: Innovation in AR and AI Startups

content.text: AR.js was an introduction to AR for some users, and there is curiosity about new open-source developments in the space.

Many new AI startups in Y Combinator resemble crypto projects. The distinction between traditional AI startups and web3 AI startups is becoming less clear, with both focusing on engagement and monetization.

categories.title: Gitpoap Digital Wearables & Eliza Bot Reply Issue

content.text: Gitpoap is a platform that allows users to create digital wearables like badges and patches using an API. A user recently discovered Gitpoap and expressed interest in exploring it further.

An issue was reported with the Eliza bot (v0.1.9), where it sometimes generates multiple replies to a single tweet due to `DEFAULT_MAX_TWEET_LENGTH`. The bot splits responses into multiple tweets when exceeding 280 characters, but in some cases, it misinterprets the split content as incomplete and generates additional replies. This results in excessive API calls (4â€“6 instead of 2), leading to high token usage and increased costs. A temporary fix is to increase `DEFAULT_MAX_TWEET_LENGTH` to a higher value, such as 500.

categories.title: Discussion on Bicamerality and Contextual References

content.text: @dankvr discusses the concept of bicamerality, referencing a post by @meta_dreamer. The discussion touches on the idea of informational weights and fairness in decision-making.
A Discord chat transcript was reviewed, but it contained only repeated mentions of '[Captain Hook]' without any meaningful discussion.

A new database adapter has been implemented using Drizzle ORM. This update introduces structured database schema management, vector operations, and embedding configurations. Key discussion points include embedding configuration injection, multiple database driver support, and RAGKnowledge compatibility. The implementation includes tables for accounts, memories, rooms, goals, logs, participants, relationships, knowledge, and cache. PostgreSQL extensions are required for vector operations. Additionally, an experimental Bun SQL implementation is being explored for multi-driver support.
New character methods have been added, but concerns have been raised about bloating the adapter. The update is not fully tested yet.

categories.title: ElizaOS Updates: Dependency Fixes and New D.A.T.A Plugin

content.text: A recent update addresses dependency issues in Eliza's main branch. This fix ensures a smoother setup process by resolving package dependencies, particularly in the package.json file. The update carries a large risk as it affects all packages but does not require documentation changes.

ElizaOS has introduced a new plugin, D.A.T.A, which enhances the AI agent's ability to fetch and analyze on-chain and off-chain data. This feature allows Eliza to provide insights into blockchain transactions, token details, and address behaviors. The integration with the main file and environment variables will be handled in a follow-up update to prevent conflicts. The update is categorized as low risk and does not require documentation changes.
